sentence.Network_en: The sudden onset of winter caused havoc with rail and air transport.
sentence.Network_cn: 冬天的突然降临让铁路和航空运输系统陷入混乱。

sentence.Network_en: Most of the passes have been closed with the onset of winter.
sentence.Network_cn: 冬天来临，大部分关口均已关闭。

sentence.Network_en: The drug must be taken from the onset of the infection.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种药必须在感染的最初期就开始服用.

entry.tran: （尤指不快之事的）开始，开端，肇始
entry.def: The onset of something is the beginning of it, used especially to refer to something unpleasant.

example.ex: Most of the passes have been closed with the onset of winter...
example.tran: 冬天来临，大部分关口均已关闭。

example.ex: With the onset of war, oil prices climbed past $30 a barrel.
example.tran: 战争一爆发，油价就攀过了每桶30美元。

means.word_mean: 2. (military) an offensive against an enemy (using weapons);

means.word_mean: 开始，开端，发生，肇始（尤指不快的事件）

sentences.en: at the onset of the war
The drug must be taken from the onset of the infection.
sentences.cn: 这种药必须在感染的最初期就开始服用。

sentences.en: His first hit record marked the onset of an astonishing career.
sentences.cn: 他的第一张风行一时的唱片标志着惊人事业的开始。

sentences.en: Our troops withstood the onset of the enemy.
sentences.cn: 我们的部队抵挡住了敌人的进攻。
